pros: Citizens UK provide an amazing training program for upcoming community organisers, teaching the best ways to mobilise communities in order to bring about change
cons: at times slightly disorganised, with hours not set and depending on events that week meaning you have to keep your timetable fairly flexible

pros: there is a good sense of team spirit

review_title: Well intentioned but lacking real impact
pros: The role has real potential for growth and expansion, in direct correlation to the effort you pour into it. Great for self-starters and visionaries who like flexibility.
cons: I worked as a community organiser at Citizens; for the most part it was a group full of beautiful, diverse and well meaning people. However mine and other co-workers experience was marred by middle management. Lack of clearly defined and reasonable objectives can be very frustrating for task and goal oriented people.

pros: can develop leadership skills while benefiting your community
cons: Nothing comes to mind. It was a great leaning experience.

review_title: Very happy I joined - a great place to work
pros: Great purpose, people and values. Everybody counts! Genuine internal comms and opportunity to get involved. Employees at all levels are included, diversity is embraced. Lots of flexible working for good work life balance. Management seriously care about employee wellbeing and have been really supportive through lockdown.
cons: None really. Being a relatively small organisation spread over the UK there are some limitations depending upon your location.
